translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
Fifth Section
The Discussion of Predestination
“Is there a knowledge that one who is not predestined will be predestined?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: niyatassa a niyāma gamanāya atthi ñāṇanti
translated: “Is there a knowledge that one who is predestined will not be predestined?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …

analyzed: niyatassa a niyāma gamanāya natthi ñāṇanti
translated: “Is there no knowledge that one who is predestined will not be predestined?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: aniyatassa niyāma gamanāya natthi ñāṇan ti
translated: “Is there no knowledge that one who is not predestined will be predestined?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the mind-object sense-sphere?” …
“Is there a knowledge that one who is not predestined will be predestined?”
“Yes.”
“Is there a knowledge that one who is predestined will be predestined?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

analyzed: niyatassa niyāma gamanāya natthi ñāṇan ti
translated: “Is there no knowledge that one who is predestined will be predestined?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: aniyatassa niyāma gamanāya natthi ñāṇan ti
translated: “Is there no knowledge that one who is not predestined will be predestined?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the mind-object sense-sphere?” …
“Is there a knowledge that one who is not predestined will be predestined?”
“Yes.”
“Is there a knowledge that one who is not predestined will not be predestined?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …
“Is there no knowledge that one who is not predestined will not be predestined?”

analyzed: aniyatassa niyāma gamanāya natthi ñāṇan ti
translated: Is there no knowledge of the one who is not definitely destined to be guided?
You should not say so.
Is there knowledge of the one who is not definitely destined to be guided?
You have said so.

analyzed: aniyatassa niyāma gamanāya atthi niyāmo ti
translated: Is there a rule for the one who is not definitely destined to be guided?
You should not say so.
Is there knowledge of the one who is not definitely destined to be guided?
You have said so.🔽Is there mindfulness for the one who is not definitely destined to be guided?

analyzed: aniyatassa niyāma gamanāya atthi sati paṭṭhānā  sammappadhānā  iddhi pādā
translated: Are there right efforts …🔽Are there bases of spiritual power …
Are there faculties …
Are there powers …
Are there factors of awakening for the one who is not definitely destined to be guided?
You should not say so.

analyzed: aniyatassa niyāma gamanāya natthi niyāmo ti
translated: Is there no rule for the one who is not definitely destined to be guided?
You have said so.

original: Hañci aniyatassa niyāmagamanāya natthi niyāmo, no vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci aniyatassa niyāma gamanāya natthi niyāmaḥ no vata re vattabbe
translated: Well, if there is no rule for the one who is not definitely destined to be guided, then you should not say,

original: “aniyatassa niyāmagamanāya atthi ñāṇan”ti.🔽Aniyatassa niyāmagamanāya natthi satipaṭṭhānā …pe…
analyzed: aniyatassa niyāma gamanāya atthi ñāṇanti  aniyatassa niyāma gamanāya natthi sati paṭṭhānā pe
translated: ‘There is knowledge of the one who is not definitely destined to be guided.’
Is there no mindfulness for the one who is not definitely destined to be guided?
You have said so.

original: Hañci aniyatassa niyāmagamanāya natthi bojjhaṅgā, no vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci aniyatassa niyāma gamanāya natthi bojjhaṅgā no vata re vattabbe
translated: Well, if there is no mindfulness for the one who is not definitely destined to be guided, then you should not say,🔽‘There is knowledge of the one who is not definitely destined to be guided.’
“There is.”
“Is there knowledge of the definite progression of the indefinite?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: gotrabhuno puggalassa sotāpatti magge ñāṇaṃ atthi iti
translated: “Is there knowledge of a person of a particular clan in the path to the fruit of stream-entry?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa sotāpattiphale ñāṇaṁ atthīti?
analyzed: sotāpatti phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa sotāpatti phale ñāṇam atthi iti
translated: “Is there knowledge of a person who is practicing for the realization of the fruit of stream-entry in the fruit of stream-entry?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: arahattasacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa arahatte ñāṇaṁ atthīti?
analyzed: arahatta sacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa puggalassa arahatte ñāṇam atthi iti
translated: “Is there knowledge of a person who is practicing for the realization of perfection in perfection?”🔽“No.”

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  na vattabba
translated: You shouldn’t say that.
“There is knowledge of the definite progression of the indefinite.”
“Yes.”
“Does the Buddha know

original: “ayaṁ puggalo sammattaniyāmaṁ okkamissati, bhabbo ayaṁ puggalo dhammaṁ abhisametun”ti?
analyzed: ayam puggalaḥ sammatta niyāmam okkamissati bhabbaḥ ayam puggalo dhammam abhisametun ti
translated: that a certain person will enter the fixed course of rightness and be capable of penetrating the Dhamma?”
“Yes.”🔽“Then you should say that the Buddha knows

original: “ayaṁ puggalo sammattaniyāmaṁ okkamissati, bhabbo ayaṁ puggalo dhammaṁ abhisametuṁ”, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: ayam puggalaḥ sammatta niyāmam okkamissati bhabbaḥ ayam puggalaḥ dhammam abhisametu tena vata re vattabbe
translated: that a certain person will enter the fixed course of rightness and be capable of penetrating the Dhamma.”
“There is a knowledge of the undetermined being determined.”
The Discussion of Determination is finished.
